instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.content: Click on a date button below to view significant events or drag the scrollbar to view the entire timeline.

day.b: Humans begin to settle in eastern Norway, growing grain and raising livestock.

month.day: Norwegians first settle on the Scandinavian peninsula during the Viking Age.

day.b: Regional groups unite to form a kingdom in Norway.

month.day: Norway enters into a union with Sweden until parliament proclaims independence.

day.b: Norway joins Sweden and Denmark in a policy of neutrality in World War I.
Norway declares its neutrality at the start of World War II. Nazi forces invade anyway, maintaining control until 1945.
Norway discovers significant deposits of oil and gas in the North Sea.
Norway hosts the Oslo Accords, playing a significant role in peace negotiations between Israel and the Palestine Liberation Organization.

month.day: A referendum rejects European Union membership with a margin of approximately 5%.
The ruling Conservative government resigns over a politically charged matter concerning power generation.

day.b: A constitutional amendment abolishes the bicameral structure of Norway’s Storting parliament, restoring it to its unicameral roots.
Center-right Conservative party wins parliamentary elections.
